author: PA News Agency
title: Sharp rise in religious hate crimes recorded by UK‚Äôs largest police forces | Salisbury Journal
text: The number of antisemitic hate crimes recorded by many of the UK‚Äôs largest police forces jumped sharply in the weeks following the outbreak of the Hamas-Israel conflict, new figures reveal. Islamophobic offences also rose for some forces, although the picture was more mixed across the country. Jewish charities called the findings ‚Äúshocking‚Äù, while campaigners against anti-Muslim abuse said the data was ‚Äúdeeply worrying‚Äù. The Home Office condemned the rise in offences, adding: ‚ÄúThere is no place for hate in our society.‚Äù The figures have been obtained by the PA news agency using Freedom of Information requests. They show that: ‚Äì Greater Manchester Police recorded 74 antisemitic offences in the month following the Hamas attacks on Israel on October 7, compared with 15 for the same period in 2022 and 14 in 2021, while West Yorkshire Police recorded 53, compared with 10 (2022) and 14 (2021). ‚Äì West Midlands Police recorded 22 antisemitic offences from October 7 to November 7, compared with one (2022) and eight (2021), while Merseyside Police recorded 20 compared with four (both 2022 and 2021). ‚Äì The British Transport Police had one of the largest increases, recording 87 antisemitic offences in the month after October 7, up from eight in the same period in 2022 and 11 in 2021, as well as a jump in Islamophobic offences with 22 (2023), up from two (2022) and eight (2021). ‚Äì West Yorkshire recorded 49 Islamophobic offences in this period in 2023, up from 29 (2022) and 38 (2021), but the pattern was not so clear for Greater Manchester (34 in 2023, 43 in 2022 and 42 in 2021) or West Midlands (25 in 2023, 33 in 2022 and 23 in 2021). The Community Security Trust described the figures as ‚Äúshocking‚Äù and said they made clear ‚Äúthe extent of the unacceptable rise in anti-Jewish hatred across the country since the Hamas terror attack on October 7‚Äù. A spokesman for the Jewish charity said: ‚ÄúThis wave of antisemitism was triggered by the mass murder, rape and kidnapping of Jews in Israel, and is fuelled and sustained by extremist hatred online and on our streets. ‚ÄúIt is essential that perpetrators are identified and prosecuted, and that wider society shows its disgust for this racist hate crime.‚Äù Tell Mama, which monitors and works to tackle anti-Muslim sentiment and abuse in the UK, told PA that ‚Äúlevels of anti-Muslim hatred and discrimination are deeply worrying, impacting trust in authorities and their sense of identity and belonging‚Äù. Iman Atta, the organisation‚Äôs director, said there had been a ‚Äúsignificant spike in anti-Muslim hate since the atrocities on October 7‚Äù, adding: ‚ÄúThe nature of many offline cases sent to our service is often overtly racist ‚Äì targeting Arab and Palestinian communities with dehumanising slurs, anti-Muslim slurs or in some cases targeting their homes, or when speaking Arabic in public, as well as targeting Muslim communities across all ages and gender. ‚ÄúWe should never allow such hatred and intolerance to take root in our communities and at this time, please look out for each other, whether Muslim or Jewish. We must stand together against intolerance, hate and racism.‚Äù The Metropolitan Police, the largest force in the UK, said delays prevented it from supplying full figures until the new year, but it had previously reported 218 antisemitic and 101 Islamophobic offences between October 1 and 18 this year, compared with 15 and 42 respectively in the same period in 2022. PA obtained full responses from 31 of the 46 forces across the UK, with the data representing a snapshot of what has currently been recorded by forces and is therefore subject to change. Methods for recording hate crime are not consistent across forces, so the data cannot be used to compare the number of offences between different areas or provide an overall total for the whole of the UK. But the figures do point to a jump in antisemitic offences recorded by forces concentrated mostly in cities or across built-up areas, while the pattern for Islamophobic offences was more varied. Some forces that operate across a mix of urban and less populated areas tend to show a similar pattern, although with lower volumes of offences ‚Äì for example Hertfordshire Police (17 antisemitic offences for the period in 2023, compared with six in 2022 and three in 2021) and Thames Valley Police (21 antisemitic offences in 2023, one in 2022 and four in 2021). Data obtained from smaller forces, or those covering areas with few towns or cities, typically showed low numbers of offences, often in single figures, meaning a clear trend was hard to determine. A spokesman for the Board of Deputies of British Jews said the findings ‚Äúprovide further evidence of the huge upsurge in antisemitism following the Hamas massacre of October 7‚Äù. The board, seen as the voice of the British Jewish community with over 300 deputies directly elected by the synagogues and communal organisations they represent, told PA the rise in antisemitism had ‚Äúcaused enormous anxiety for Jewish people, particularly children and Jewish students on campus or indeed anyone easily identified as Jewish by their dress‚Äù. A spokesman added: ‚ÄúWe call on police to take strong action against anyone found to be perpetrating hate crimes.‚Äù The Muslim Council of Britain said: ‚ÄúDespite the extremely low reporting rate from Muslim communities, the huge increase in Islamophobic hate crimes recorded with the police reflects what we are seeing from third-party reporting groups. ‚ÄúThe Government‚Äôs laissez-faire attitude to Islamophobia contrasts strongly with its no-tolerance approach to antisemitism. We are hopeful this will now change.‚Äù A spokesperson for the Home Office said: ‚ÄúThere is no place for hate in our society and we condemn the recent rise in reported antisemitic and anti-Muslim hatred. ‚ÄúWe expect the police to fully investigate all hate crimes and work with the CPS to make sure the cowards who commit these abhorrent offences feel the full force of the law. ‚ÄúFollowing recent events, we have also made further funding available to Jewish and Muslim communities, to provide additional security at places of worship and faith schools.‚Äù Comments: Our rules We want our comments to be a lively and valuable part of our community - a place where readers can debate and engage with the most important local issues. The ability to comment on our stories is a privilege, not a right, however, and that privilege may be withdrawn if it is abused or misused. Please report any comments that break our rules. [Read the rules here](/misc/comments) Comments are closed on this article

author: Il Resto del Carlino
title: Contratto Industria, c'√® il via libera. I lavoratori dicono s√¨ all'unanimit√†
text:
Via libera da parte dei lavoratori al contratto industria . Con una schiacciante vittoria dei s√¨ al referendum , i dipendenti del comparto privato hanno votato per estendere i benefici del Testo Unico a tutti i lavoratori e lavoratrici del settore industriale. Un via libera arrivato al termine di una lunga serie di assemblee sui posti di lavoro. Il Testo Unico del contratto collettivo dell‚ÄôIndustria √® stato sottoscritto poco pi√π di un anno fa e fin da subito applicato dalla maggior parte delle aziende afferenti con effetto retroattivo al primo gennaio e validit√† quinquennale. "Si tratta ‚Äì spiegano in coro i segretari della Federazione Industria di Csdl, Cdls e Usl ‚Äì dell‚Äôultimo atto della campagna referendaria che ha visto la massima partecipazione dei lavoratori per conferire attraverso il loro voto efficacia ‚Äòerga omnes‚Äô al contratto: stesse condizioni e diritti per tutti, siano essi lavoratori sammarinesi o frontalieri". Il contratto di settore "consente maggiore stabilit√† e certezza ai lavoratori in una fase di indeterminatezza generale, oltre a porre un argine a difesa della pace sociale. Prevede, lo ricordiamo, un aumento programmato del 9,7% nei cinque anni, a cui si aggiunge il 4% di recupero dell‚Äôinflazione degli anni precedenti. Questi aumenti saranno assoggettati a verifica biennale, cos√¨ da mantenere il potere d‚Äôacquisto in linea con l‚Äôinflazione reale registrata". L‚Äôobiettivo infatti "resta ‚Äì dicono dai sindacati ‚Äì quello di salvaguardare gli aumenti allineandoli all‚Äôinflazione, proteggendo le retribuzioni da impennate inflazionistiche fino alla soglia pattuita del 15% nel periodo di vigenza del contratto. Inoltre, per i lavoratori con pi√π di 11 anni di servizio nella stessa azienda, il nuovo contratto ha previsto anche un ulteriore scatto di anzianit√† definita ‚Äòemolumento di fidelizzazione‚Äô del valore pari al 2,5%". Diverse le novit√† sul fronte normativo tra le quali c‚Äô√® la volont√† di regolamentare la donazione di ferie allo scopo di poter accudire i propri familiari nei quali sia insorta una gravissima patologia permanente o temporanea. Le Federazioni Industria dei sindacati dopo la pausa estiva, avvieranno la stessa procedura di consultazione sui luoghi di lavoro per il contratto dell‚Äôartigianato. Ora, l‚Äôesito referendario sar√† al vaglio del Comitato Garante per certificare la validit√† del voto.
¬© Riproduzione riservata

author: irpino
title: Flumeri, danneggiata la Nativit√†, gambe spezzate a Ges√π Bambino
text:
Comunit√† indignata e sconcertata per il deprecabile atto vandalico compiuto in Campo Giglio. Qualcuno ha danneggiato la Nativit√† luminosa ma soprattutto il Ges√π Bambino adagiato nella mangiatoia. Gli sono state spezzate le gambe.
Senza parole il sindaco di Flumeri, Angelo Lanza, nel pubblicare sulla sua pagina facebook la foto dello scempio. Parole di incredulit√† ma soprattutto di rabbia, invece nei commenti dei cittadini. Ce la si prende con la mancanza di valori e di educazione da parte dei ragazzi. Ma al momento non √® dato sapere chi √® l‚Äôautore o gli autori del gesto che √® a tutti gli effetti sacrilego poich√© √® stato toccato il simbolo per eccellenza del Natale e della fede cristiana, Ges√π.
Qualcuno invoca telecamere e giustizia affinch√® i colpevoli vengano individuati e puniti. Il sindaco replica che ¬´saranno visionate, ma il punto resta un altro, servirebbe educare e non punire¬ª.
Dunque telecamere presenti e funzionanti, immagini al vaglio della Polizia municipale. Sicuramente ci sar√† un colpevole e ci√≤ che tutti vorranno chiedergli √® ¬´perch√®¬ª.

author: Julia B√∫rian
title: Chuvas e ventanias podem atingir 16 estados nesta semana; saiba mais
text:
Chuvas e ventanias podem atingir 16 estados nesta semana; saiba mais
Alguns pa√≠ses est√£o com alerta de ‚ÄúPerigo‚Äù ou ‚ÄúPerigo Potencial‚Äù
Nesta quinta-feira (13), tr√™s alertas de chuvas intensas foram emitidos pelo Instituto Nacional de Meteorologia (Inmet). O comunicado abrange 16 estados e o Distrito Federal, correspondendo a baixa e m√©dia intensidade.
O alerta aponta ‚ÄúPerigo‚Äù para Amazonas, Bahia, Esp√≠rito Santo, Goi√°s, Mato Grosso, Minas Gerais, Par√°, Rond√¥nia e Distrito Federal. O Inmet tamb√©m aconselha que as pessoas n√£o procurem abrigo debaixo de √°rvores, por conta do risco de quedas e descargas el√©tricas. Al√©m disso, tamb√©m √© recomendado que os motoristas n√£o estacionem pr√≥ximos a torres de transmiss√£o e placas de propaganda.
Enquanto isso, h√° ainda o aviso de ‚ÄúPerigo Potencial‚Äù para os estados do Acre, Amap√°, Amazonas, Bahia, Esp√≠rito Santo, Goi√°s, Maranh√£o, Mato Grosso, Mato Grosso do Sul, Minas Gerais, Par√°, Rio de Janeiro, Rond√¥nia, Roraima, S√£o Paulo, Tocantins e, novamente, o Distrito Federal.
A perspectiva do Inmet √© de que os estados sejam atingidos por ventos intensos, mas com baixo risco de queda de galhos de √°rvores, alagamentos, descargas el√©tricas e corte da energia el√©trica.
Recomenda√ß√µes em dias de chuvas
Por conta da mudan√ßa de clima, o ideal √© seguir algumas [recomenda√ß√µes](https://minhasaude.proteste.org.br/sao-paulo-tera-fortes-chuvas-e-vendaval-nesta-sexta-veja-previsao/) para se manter seguro durante o per√≠odo de instabilidade:
- Fique de olho na previs√£o do tempo: Acompanhar os alertas dos √≥rg√£os de meteorologia √© importante para entender a situa√ß√£o do
[clima](https://minhasaude.proteste.org.br/qual-foi-o-ano-mais-quente-do-brasil-veja-a-resposta/). - Evite andar por √°reas alagadas: Quando h√° chuva intensa nas regi√µes urbanas, tente n√£o transitar por ruas e avenidas que alagam para evitar acidentes.
- Opte por lugares seguros: Caso esteja fora de casa durante tempestades, procure abrigo em locais seguros e evite ao m√°ximo ficar em √°reas abertas.
- Verifique sempre o clima antes de sair de casa: Quando for fazer alguma atividade fora de casa, tente planej√°-las seguindo a previs√£o do tempo. No caso, isso vai ajudar a evitar exposi√ß√£o desnecess√°ria a condi√ß√µes clim√°ticas adversas.
As informa√ß√µes s√£o do [Jornal O Globo](https://oglobo.globo.com/brasil/noticia/2024/12/12/previsao-do-tempo-16-estados-serao-impactados-por-chuvas-e-ventos-podem-chegar-ate-100-kmh-nesta-quinta.ghtml).

author: @1011_news
title: New north Lincoln senior living community offers views of Salt Creek Watershed
text:
Located just south of Interstate 80‚Äôs 27th street exit, the Salt Creek Senior Living community includes 62 assisted living and 25 memory care units. By Matthew Mittlieder Published: Nov. 7, 2024 at 7:08 PM CST | Updated: 2 hours ago Email This Link
Share on Facebook
Share on X (formerly Twitter)
Share on Pinterest
Share on LinkedIn
LINCOLN, Neb. (KOLN) - A new senior living center in north Lincoln has opened up, boasting a more than 93,000 square-foot community on the Salt Creek Watershed.
Located just south of Interstate 80‚Äôs 27th street exit, the Salt Creek Senior Living community owned by Dial Senior Living in Omaha includes 62 assisted living and 25 memory care units.
Officials said having a facility surrounded by the saline wetlands gives residents views of the landscape, all of which are protected by a conservation easement.
Joe Bohac, the Salt Creek Senior Living advisor, said that with the lack of senior centers in northern Lincoln, this community will serve a whole host of new people.
‚ÄúEvery day we‚Äôre getting older,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAnd we‚Äôre getting ready to hit the baby boomer generation that‚Äôs looking for senior living. So to have another option in the City of Lincoln, we felt there was a huge need for that.‚Äù
Other features of the facility include a dog park, theater, hair salon, wine bar and a fitness center.
The project has been in development since 2017 when planning first began, and opened in October.
Click here to subscribe to our 10/11 NOW daily digest and breaking news alerts delivered straight to your email inbox.
Copyright 2024 KOLN. All rights reserved.

author: Stuart Hess
title: Wolvaardt‚Äôs five-star CSA awards night confirms superwoman status
text:
Cricket Wolvaardt‚Äôs five-star CSA awards night confirms superwoman status 05 September 2024 - 21:53 Stuart Hess Sports reporter Just R20 for the first month. Support independent journalism by subscribing to our digital news package. Subscribe now Laura Wolvaardt's status as one of SA's best cricketers was underlined by her claiming five prizes at the Cricket SA awards ceremony on Thursday night.
Image: Mark Metcalfe/Getty Images
Laura Wolvaardt‚Äôs excellence with the bat and her resolve as newly-installed Proteas Women‚Äôs captain saw her scoop five prizes at Cricket SA‚Äôs Professional Awards ceremony on Thursday night.
Wolvaardt was named Women‚Äôs Player of the Year and took home best ODI, T20 and the Players Player titles. She also claimed the Fan‚Äôs favourite player prize.
On the men‚Äôs side the main award went to Marco Jansen, whose overall influence across the three formats earned the 24-year-old the Player of the Year Award.
Because the ceremony only recognised achievements in the period from August last year to the end of last season in May, key performances at big events like the men‚Äôs T20 World Cup were ignored.
hot cover drives X laura wolvaardt pic.twitter.com/n2YxEe2JSy
‚Äî sana khan. (@reverseswingerr) December 9, 2023 Reeza Hendricks was named T20 Player of the Year. Quinton de Kock won ODI Player of the Year.
Ideally CSA would have wanted the awards to take place at the end of the 2023-24 season, but that would have meant a host of players ‚Äî both men and women ‚Äî would have missed the festivities because they were playing in leagues overseas.
In the case of Proteas T20 captain Aiden Markram, he travelled to India in March for the Indian Premier League, then headed straight to New York for the T20 World Cup, followed that with a stint in the US's Major League Cricket, went straight to the West Indies for Tests and T20s and only returned home last week.
Wolvaardt had a stunning season, showing that far from it being a burden, the captaincy was something she relished. In 12 ODIs she scored four centuries, including a new South African record of 184 against Sri Lanka, averaging 80.55 in the format.
Marco Jansen with a blinder pic.twitter.com/orpeIxmQlG
‚Äî Werner (@Werries_) June 8, 2024 She also scored her first T20 International century against Sri Lanka in March and though it didn‚Äôt fall in the judging period her maiden Test century against India in June, further demonstrated how well she balanced the demands of captaincy with the responsibility of being the team‚Äôs best batter.
Her achievements are even more notable because she took over a team in transition at a time when there was angst among senior players about the direction the Proteas were taking while CSA continued to fret over the process of appointing a new coach.
Though Dillon du Preez will continue as interim coach at next month‚Äôs T20 World Cup, director of cricket Enoch Nkwe this week confirmed Wolvaardt‚Äôs team would finally have a permanent coach to work with from November 1.
Jansen‚Äôs reward as Player of the Year resulted primarily from his excellent showing at last year‚Äôs ODI World Cup, where he finished as the Proteas' second-highest wicket-taker with 17 and also scored 157 runs that included a match-turning 75 not out in the round-robin match against England in Mumbai.
"Stands up for South Africa when it really matters."
Competing against a NZ home side is not easy. Scoring a century in üá≥üáø is not easy either.
David Bedingham scoring his maiden century when nobody expected üáøüá¶ to even compete is a lovely story pic.twitter.com/aSVNbZCm9n
‚Äî Broken Cricket Dreams Cricket Blog (@cricket_broken) February 15, 2024 He shared a partnership of 161 runs with Heinrich Klaasen, which took South Africa from 233/4, a situation in which the match was still in the balance, to 399/7, setting up a comfortable win.
In just two Tests, he made a crucial unbeaten 84 and picked up four wickets in the victory in the first Test against India at Centurion.
David Bedingham‚Äôs first international summer, earned him both the Newcomer and Test Player of the Year awards, while Keshav Maharaj, walked away with the Players Player crown, a recognition of his instrumental role in all three formats.
Bedingham made a half century on debut against India and followed that with a century in Wellington against New Zealand, where he was part of a drastically weakened squad.
The men‚Äôs domestic prizes were dominated by the Gauteng Lions. Leg-spinner, Nqaba Peter earned the Domestic Newcomer and T20 Challenge titles, Wiaan Mulder was Division 1 Four-Day Player of the Year, Bjorn Fortuin won the Domestic Players Player of the Year and Russell Domingo was named the best coach in Division 1.

author: Lauren Watson
title: Retired Marine and cancer survivor celebrates remission with 10-hour swim
text:
COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo. ( KKTV /Gray News) - A retired Marine and cancer survivor in Colorado celebrates the anniversary of his remission with a feat he picked up during his service.
Michael LaBarge said he was diagnosed with glioblastoma multiforme, grade IV brain cancer, 21 years ago on April 2.
LaBarge said he has been in remission for a while and that he swims for 10 hours on the anniversary to celebrate it.
‚ÄúThe prognosis was two weeks to 10 months ‚Ä¶ 21 years ago,‚Äù he told KKTV . ‚ÄúI did this a lot in the Marines. [Today,] I started at 6 a.m., stopping at 4 p.m.‚Äù
He completed his swim this year at the U.S. Air Force Academy‚Äôs Community Pool in Colorado Springs.
Chris Gesterling, the USAFA Pool Aquatics Manager, said he often sees LaBarge at the pool, and his story of surviving cancer is inspiring.
‚ÄúFormer Marine ... you know, he beat brain cancer so everything is possible for him,‚Äù Gesterling said.
As LaBarge swam, he also shared his message for those fighting similar battles to the one he faced.
‚ÄúHopefully, this will inspire people with cancer to get out, stay active and, you know, don‚Äôt get too down on themselves,‚Äù he said.
Copyright 2024 KKTV via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.
